main event: A saucer-shaped object was sighted in Towes, North Dakota, on November 7, 1957.
interesting points: The object was described as being the size of a basketball and at a very high altitude., Witnesses reported a very bright light associated with the object., The sighting was classified as ground-visual observation., Multiple possible explanations were noted including aircraft, satellites, and balloons., The object faded with increasing distance and moved from southwest to west.
sighted object: saucer-shaped object emitting a very bright light
witness description: cattle trucker and gas station operator
